name: Chatham
description: Chatham is a charming town on the elbow of Cape Cod, Massachusetts, renowned for its stunning beaches, rich maritime history, and vibrant local culture. With its picturesque lighthouses, quaint downtown area, and abundance of outdoor activities, Chatham offers a quintessential Cape Cod experience for visitors of all ages.

attractions.name: Chatham Lighthouse Beach
attractions.description: A scenic beach with a historic lighthouse, perfect for sunbathing, beachcombing, and seal watching. The beach offers breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean and is known for its strong currents, making it popular among surfers.
attractions.opening_hours: 6:00 AM - 10:00 PM (Beach); Lighthouse tours available seasonally

attractions.name: Atwood House Museum
attractions.description: A museum showcasing the rich history of Chatham through fascinating exhibits and artifacts. The museum includes an 18th-century house, art gallery, and extensive archives of local history.

attractions.name: Chatham Fish Pier
attractions.description: A bustling pier where you can watch the local fishing fleet unload their daily catch. It's also a great spot for seal watching and enjoying fresh seafood at the adjacent market.

attractions.name: Monomoy National Wildlife Refuge
attractions.description: A protected area offering hiking trails, birdwatching opportunities, and stunning coastal views. The refuge is home to diverse wildlife, including seals and numerous bird species.

attractions.name: Chatham Marconi Maritime Center
attractions.description: A museum dedicated to the history of wireless communication, featuring interactive exhibits and educational programs about maritime radio technology.

restaurants.name: Impudent Oyster
restaurants.description: A popular seafood restaurant known for its fresh and innovative dishes, including locally sourced oysters, clams, and fish. The cozy, historic setting adds to its charm.
restaurants.opening_hours: Lunch: 11:30 AM - 2:30 PM, Dinner: 5:00 PM - 9:00 PM

restaurants.name: Chatham Village Cafe & Bakery
restaurants.description: A delightful bakery offering a variety of freshly baked goods, gourmet coffee, and light lunch options. Known for their delicious pastries and friendly service.
restaurants.opening_hours: Monday-Saturday: 6:00 AM - 3:00 PM, Sunday: 6:00 AM - 1:00 PM

restaurants.name: The Chatham Squire
restaurants.description: A local institution serving classic New England fare in a casual, pub-like atmosphere. Popular among locals and tourists alike for its seafood, burgers, and lively bar scene.

restaurants.name: Bluefins Sushi & Sake Bar
restaurants.description: An upscale sushi restaurant offering fresh, creative rolls and an extensive sake list. The modern decor and attentive service make it perfect for a special night out.

accommodations.name: Chatham Bars Inn
accommodations.description: A luxurious oceanfront resort offering stunning ocean views, elegant rooms, top-notch amenities, and a private beach. Features multiple dining options, a spa, and various recreational activities.

accommodations.name: The Old Harbor Inn
accommodations.description: A cozy bed and breakfast with charming rooms and exceptional hospitality. Located in the heart of Chatham, it offers easy access to shops, restaurants, and beaches.

accommodations.name: Chatham Tides Waterfront Lodging
accommodations.description: A family-friendly waterfront motel offering comfortable rooms with kitchenettes, a private beach, and beautiful views of Pleasant Bay.
accommodations.address: 97 Old Harbor Rd, North Chatham, MA 02650

accommodations.name: Queen Anne Inn
accommodations.description: A historic inn featuring Victorian-style rooms, beautifully landscaped gardens, and a convenient location near Chatham's main attractions.

activities.name: Seal Watching
activities.description: Enjoy a boat tour to see seals in their natural habitat around Chatham and Monomoy Island. Learn about local marine life from knowledgeable guides.

activities.name: Fishing
activities.description: Experience deep-sea fishing with local charters, perfect for anglers of all levels. Target species include striped bass, bluefish, and tuna.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore Chatham's diverse waterways, from calm harbors to the open ocean. Rentals and guided tours available for all skill levels.

activities.name: Biking
activities.description: Cycle through scenic Chatham and the surrounding areas on the Old Colony Rail Trail. Bike rentals available in town.

events.name: Chatham Festival of the Arts
events.description: Annual outdoor art festival featuring works by local and regional artists. Held in mid-July on the grounds of the Monomoy Regional Middle School.

events.name: Chatham Shark Week
events.description: A week-long celebration of sharks, featuring educational programs, beach cleanups, and family-friendly activities. Typically held in July.
